name: Piadina (Italian Flatbread)
author: rosa
summary: Piadina is an Italian flatbread from Emilia-Romagna region. The traditional recipe calls for lard in the dough which you can replace with a good extra-virgin olive oil. It is typically served stuffed with prosciutto and a local cheese called squacquerone but any soft cheese will work. Enjoy!
directions: Mix flour and salt together in a large bowl
Mix in water a little at a time
Rub in lard until dough comes together in a ball
Transfer dough to a lightly floured work surface; knead until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes
Divide the dough into 6 pieces; roll out each piece to 1/16-inch thickness
Heat a dry, heavy skillet or flat griddle over medium-high heat
Cook each piece until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side
